[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Restaurant Management System (RMS) defines functional and non-functional requirements for usability, seamless real-time data accessibility, compliance enforcement, and secure integration with external APIs.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: RMS supports intuitive data display, structured workflow navigation, transaction tracking, and automated financial calculations.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: RMS connects to POS, cloud storage, authentication APIs, and financial services for transaction processing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: RMS provides a web-based and mobile UI with structured navigation.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: RMS runs on tablets, touchscreen POS terminals, and desktops.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: RMS uses React.js for frontend, Node.js with Express for backend, PostgreSQL for data storage, and Redis for caching.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: RMS ensures secure API communication using REST/WebSockets.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: RMS optimizes memory usage for fast data retrieval.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: RMS ensures continuous availability with automated feature updates, security patches, and performance optimizations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: RMS supports cloud-based access and local installations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: RMS uses OAuth 2.0 for authentication and integrates with financial APIs.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: RMS supports structured navigation, compliance enforcement, and transaction management.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: RMS is designed for restaurant managers and chefs with minimal technical training.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: RMS requires internet connectivity for cloud features and API calculations.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: RMS relies on authentication APIs, cloud storage, and standardized financial calculations.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: EULA: End-User License Agreement users must accept before access.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall provide web-based and mobile accessibility with real-time data synchronization.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall integrate with authentication APIs to enforce EULA acceptance.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow managers and chefs to navigate digital menus, modify orders, track reservations, and access inventory data with a structured UI (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall ensure all functions are available at startup and require EULA agreement before first access (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall comply with user-defined norms for calculations and prevent unauthorized modifications (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive UI, reducing reliance on extensive manuals.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall ensure low-latency interactions, processing user actions without significant delay.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store user preferences, system settings, and access logs.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall support cloud-hosted deployment with cross-platform accessibility.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to authentication and licensing standards (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure real-time availability, transaction monitoring, and proactive failure detection through automated system health checks.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Navigation, accessibility, compliance, and EULA enforcement validated.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API integration guides, and compliance documentation.
[SEC] 5. References: Restaurant management best practices, authentication security policies, and licensing compliance standards.
